website_summaries.verdict: Admirably sticky—this is a rather fitting description for the Anasazi LV from Five Ten. Besides surface traction, however, the shoe also offers much in the areas of sensitivity and comfort. It is a force to be reckoned with in the edging department as well.That said, those who are inclined to get it must be willing to shell out a couple of bucks. Nonetheless, the Five Ten Anasazi LV has excellence written all over it, thanks to its set of climb-worthy characteristics.
pros: The Five Ten Anasazi LV has a highly tenacious outsole, according to gear pundits who have tested it
This remarkable Five Ten offering is intensely sensitive, say bloggers who have purchased it
The Anasazi LV's ability to edge is astonishing, say some testers
A few wearers who have ascended in this climb-exclusive shoe swear by its high level of comfort
It is easy to slip in and out of this footwear product, based on one of Five Ten Anasazi LV’s reviews
cons: Although made with a synthetic upper, its material stretched a bit, says one reviewer
An expert who has invested in this shoe considers it an expensive item

customer_reviews.title: Refund policy is a JOKE
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure the shoe itself is quite lovely but Wild Sherpa has a VERY strict refund policy. Apparently trying them on and standing up constituted as “used” and I only got a 50% refund after returning them for being too small. I neither climbed nor walked in them but they told me both shoes had dirt and scuff marks. Clearly I could not prove otherwise so it’s my word against theirs and the “house” always wins. So be sure of your shoe size before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Manrie Bacon

customer_reviews.title: It is a same because I absolutely LOVE the performance of the Anasazi
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair pf Anasazi's. I did go up a half size for this round to 8 as the 7.5 I believe are the cause for the development of a bunion. I have never had a bunion before but it is proving very uncomfortable. It is a same because I absolutely LOVE the performance of the Anasazi...I can always be assured that my foot will stick on even the smallest nub. I know use these shoes for harder climbs and more comfortable ones for warm ups.
customer_reviews.author: Kee

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sport Climbing
customer_reviews.text: I wear a street size 9 and got a size 9.5 with these. I have average size feet in width I would think. When I tried them on at home, I felt like they were going to be too tight, but I was going on a day trip the following day so I waited to decide. Wearing them outside made all the difference. I was able to stick into tiny holds with confidence and did not notice any discomfort on the wall. Back on the ground, I did have to take them off between climbs, but that was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Nicole Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: ... had to size up with these but I do love em.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely had to size up with these but I do love em.
customer_reviews.author: Tegan MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great mid level shoe, runs a bit tight.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product 4 stars because it performs exactly as I hoped it would, but the fit is a bit tight and I still have to take them off between routes. I hoped the less aggressive camber of the shoe would mean that I could leave them on more often than I take them off. Pros: 1.) Love the velcro 2.) Pointy toe meant I can balance on tiny holds 3.) sticky rubber sole keeps me on the wall Cons: 1.) Small, even for a climbing shoe
customer_reviews.author: Amazonist

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great for sport climbing on moderate inclines. Not the best choice for hard boulders or overhangs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great edging
customer_reviews.text: Love these, a bit narrower than the men's version but same great edging power. After a few breaking sessions they seem to mold to my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Karin

customer_reviews.title: and are a little painful, but I think they just need to stretch ...
customer_reviews.text: My biggest surprise with these shoes is how small they run. I am a street size 6 or 6.5, so I initially ordered a 6. They were way too small, so I went to the store to try to find the right size. REI didn't have this shoe style, but they did have this same brand. With that I determined I was about a 7.5 in these shoes. My 7.5s fit tight, and are a little painful, but I think they just need to stretch out a little. Overall I like the comfort that these shoes provided when compared to la sportiva miura vs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes! I ordered my street size and the fit is perfect. The rubber is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Anazasi mocassym however this time I decided to try a different shoe. The Anazasi LV fit my feet perfectly! I have very narrow feet so most climbing shoes are normally too wide for me. My street shoe size is 8.5 and I ordered same size for the LV. It was the perfect size, size 8 was too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but small
customer_reviews.text: I sized up a half size from my street shoe and these are still too tight after months of wear in the local gym. They are perfectly shaped for my feet and I really like the velcro feature. They are sticky and a lovely color.
customer_reviews.author: yeaks

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I liked this shoe but unfortunately it was way too small! I fit street shoe 8, and sized up half size because of reviews.. one shoe fit great although a bit tight and the 2nd shoe fit even tighter. I've never had issues with one foot bigger than the other so not sure if this was product or me. The straps were also all black and did not match the straps in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe! Just check the sizing...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoe once I found the right size. I was also suprised at how small the run. My street shoe is a 5.5 so I ordered the 6 and my toes were curled up once i got them on. Went to REI and the 7 was a little snug but I think it will be perfect after breaking in a little. I'd recommend ordering a size up or a size and a half up. Amazon's return/refund process was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: But still an awesome shoe and the rubber is perfect for credit cards ...
customer_reviews.text: They are somewhat small, even for climbing shoes. But still an awesome shoe and the rubber is perfect for credit cards and the various terrains we come across in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: I love this show but these were Way too small despite ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this show but these were Way too small despite ordering half size larger than my regular shoe size. Already returned to try a different size. Really appreciate the ease of return through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli

customer_reviews.title: Just writing to give some more color on the sizing ...
customer_reviews.text: Just writing to give some more color on the sizing of these shoes. I normally wear a ladies size 5 street shoe or a 35 euro. I ordered a 5.5 and a 6 in these based on other reviews that they ran small. Well, they run really, REALLY small. Even the size 6 was beyond too tight for me. They were more than just "snug".....my toes were totally curled up at the end of the shoe. Only a 3 star review because I wasn't actually able to use them and review how well they would work for climbing.
customer_reviews.author: JB5150

customer_reviews.title: The number is wrong
customer_reviews.text: I need to return them or change them for a bigger pair, how can I do? They don't fit me at all
customer_reviews.author: Romina

customer_reviews.title: A great deal
customer_reviews.text: As my first ever pair of climbing shoes, they are a great deal. I've been having a great time in them climbing. Of course, I don't know much about climbing shoes yet, but I feel like they have a great arch support, nice rubber etc. My usual shoe size is a 7, and got an 8 for the climbing shoes. I have to wear them with no socks.
customer_reviews.author: Xin Luan

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected for small and narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: Five Ten is amazing at actually have fit as expected for people with smaller and narrower feet! I wear a size 5 women's for regular shoes, and size 5 for Anasazi was perfect (with other brands stores never have my size...for example,I am a size 3 for La Sportiva). People with wider feet may need to size up. The C4 stealth rubber is amazing for indoor and sport climbing in cooler temperature. Only downside is the material...synthetics will accumulate odor over time. Even with washing and airing on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Nessie Gann

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm not skilled enough to provide a detail climbing-technical review other than the rubber allows me to stick to the smoothest chips and smear on the wall far better than my laSportivas ever did, and the great angle in the toe helps me stabilize on the smallest chips. I did need to upsize a complete size (i am a true 7.5 in street shoe) for these and am thrilled with them!
customer_reviews.author: nipponbabybaby

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bouldering!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely get half size bigger. Very tight, but great shoes! A bit technical but awesome for bouldering! Can't wait to try it outdoors!
customer_reviews.author: JDRUGBY

product_meta.title: Five Ten Womens Anasazi LV-W Anasazi Lv-w
product_meta.description: Five Ten, the Brand of the Brave, is a leader in performance, high-friction footwear. From downhill mountain bike racing to rock climbing, from wing suit flying to kayaking, Five Ten makes footwear for the world's most dangerous sports. The Redlands, California-based company has been producing cutting-edge designs and proprietary Stealth rubber soles for nearly 30 years. With the help of top national and international athletes and guides, combined with a world-class rubber-testing and R&D facility, Five Ten is the shoe brand of choice for the world's most exciting athletes.
feature_bullets: Climbing Shoes by Five Ten - Gender: Women
Product type: Womens performance sensitive climbing shoe
